 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_KEY_MANAGEMENT_READ` - Read and list public keys for various FS security features.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_KEY_MANAGEMENT_WRITE` - Create and manage public keys for various FS security features.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_LOCK_READ` - View NLM and SMB locks and waiters,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_LOCK_WRITE` - Release NLM and SMB locks,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_SETTINGS_READ` - View file system permissions settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Modify file system permissions mode,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FTP_READ` - View FTP status and settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FTP_WRITE` - Modify FTP status and settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_CONFIG_READ` - Read and list identity configurations.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_CONFIG_WRITE` - Modify identity configurations.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_MAPPING_READ` - Get AD/LDAP User Defined Mappings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_MAPPING_WRITE` - Set AD/LDAP User Defined Mappings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_READ` - Use Qumulo's identity lookup and translation APIs,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_WRITE` - Modify identity attributes and clear authentication cache,
 * `PRIVILEGE_KERBEROS_KEYTAB_READ` - View Kerberos keytab,
 * `PRIVILEGE_KERBEROS_KEYTAB_WRITE` - Modify Kerberos keytab,
 * `PRIVILEGE_KERBEROS_SETTINGS_READ` - Read Kerberos settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_KERBEROS_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Modify Kerberos settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_KV_READ` - DEPRECATED: Read and delete KV store entries for all users,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LDAP_READ` - View LDAP settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LDAP_USE` - Use Qumulo's APIs for performing LDAP queries,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LDAP_WRITE` - Modify LDAP settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LICENSE_READ` - Get the cluster's license status.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LOCAL_GROUP_READ` - View local groups and members,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LOCAL_GROUP_WRITE` - Modify local groups and membership,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LOCAL_USER_READ` - Get information about local users,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LOCAL_USER_WRITE` - Create and modify all local users,
 * `PRIVILEGE_METRICS_CONFIG_READ` - View metrics configuration,
 * `PRIVILEGE_METRICS_CONFIG_WRITE` - Modify metrics configuration,
 * `PRIVILEGE_METRICS_READ` - Get all metrics,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NETWORK_IP_ALLOCATION_READ` - View network IP address allocations,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NETWORK_READ` - Read network status and settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NETWORK_WRITE` - Modify network configuration,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NFS_EXPORT_READ` - View configuration of NFS exports,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NFS_EXPORT_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete NFS exports,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NFS_SETTINGS_READ` - Internal-Only: View NFS server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NFS_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Internal-Only: Modify NFS server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_OBJECT_STORAGE_URIS_READ` - View the object storage URIs.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_OBJECT_STORAGE_URIS_WRITE` - Add new object storage URIs.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_GLOBAL_READ` - View global portal settings and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_HUB_READ` - View hub portal relationship status and configuration,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_HUB_WRITE` - Authorize, modify, and delete hub portal relationships. Granting this privilege allows authorizing proposed relationships. Depending on existing file and directory permissions, this privilege can allow remote access to local data under the hub root directory.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_SPOKE_EVICT` - Remove cached files and directories from a spoke portal. Qumulo Core recaches the removed files or directories upon access.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_SPOKE_READ` - View spoke portal relationship status and configuration,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_SPOKE_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete spoke portal relationships. Granting this privilege allows creating spoke portal root directories. Depending on existing file permissions, this privilege can allow local access to remote files and directories.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_POWER_CYCLE` - Shutdown and reboot nodes,
 * `PRIVILEGE_QUOTA_READ` - View all file system quotas,
 * `PRIVILEGE_QUOTA_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete file system quotas,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REBOOT_READ` - View Reboot Status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REBOOT_USE` - Perform Reboots,
 * `PRIVILEGE_RECONCILER_READ` - View reconciler status and metrics,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_OBJECT_READ` - View object store relationship settings and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_OBJECT_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete object store relationships. Granting this privilege allows overwriting existing data, replicating, and potentially accessing any data on the cluster regardless of file and directory permissions.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_REVERSE_RELATIONSHIP` - Reverse a source and target relationship,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_SOURCE_READ` - View source relationship settings and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_SOURCE_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete source relationships. Granting this privilege allows replicating and potentially accessing any data on the cluster regardless of file and directory permissions.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_TARGET_READ` - View target relationship settings and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_TARGET_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete target relationships. Granting this privilege allows overwriting any data on the cluster regardless of file and directory permissions.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_ROLE_READ` - View roles and assignments,
 * `PRIVILEGE_ROLE_WRITE` - Create and modify roles and assignments,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_BUCKETS_READ` - View all S3 buckets and bucket policies present in the system,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_BUCKETS_WRITE` - Create or delete any S3 bucket in the system, and create, delete, or modify policies for any S3 bucket in the system. Subject to having sufficient FS permissions.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_CREDENTIALS_READ` - View any S3 access key present in the system,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_CREDENTIALS_WRITE` - Create or delete S3 access keys for any user in the system,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_SETTINGS_READ` - View S3 server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Modify S3 server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_UPLOADS_READ` - View all S3 uploads present in the system. This will override a bucket policy that denies the user this permission.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_UPLOADS_WRITE` - Abort S3 uploads in the system. This will override a bucket policy that denies the user this permission.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SAML_SETTINGS_READ` - View SAML integration settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SAML_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Modify SAML integration settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SERVICE_PUBLIC_KEYS_READ` - Internal-Only: Read public keys,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SERVICE_PUBLIC_KEYS_WRITE` - Internal-Only: Write public keys,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_FILE_HANDLE_READ` - List open SMB file handles,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_FILE_HANDLE_WRITE` - Force close an open SMB file handle,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_SESSION_READ` - List logged on SMB sessions,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_SESSION_WRITE` - Force close a logged on SMB session,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_SHARE_READ` - View configuration of SMB shares and SMB server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_SHARE_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete SMB shares and SMB server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_CALCULATE_USED_CAPACITY_READ` - Recalculate capacity usage of snapshots,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_DIFFERENCE_READ` - View the changes between snapshots,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_LOCK` - Lock or unlock snapshots. Configure snapshot policies to lock or unlock snapshots.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_POLICY_READ` - View snapshot policies and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_POLICY_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete snapshot policies,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_READ` - List snapshots and view their status and cached capacity. Does not affect the visibility of the virtual `.snapshot` directories,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete snapshots,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SUPPORT_READ` - View support configuration and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SUPPORT_WRITE` - Modify cloud-based monitoring and remote management,
 * `PRIVILEGE_TENANT_READ` - View any tenant information,
 * `PRIVILEGE_TENANT_WRITE` - Create, edit or delete tenants,
 * `PRIVILEGE_TEST_ONLY` - Test only actions,
 * `PRIVILEGE_TIME_READ` - View time and time settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_TIME_WRITE` - Modify time settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_UNCONFIGURED_NODE_READ` - List unconfigured Qumulo nodes,
 * `PRIVILEGE_UPGRADE_READ` - View upgrade configuration and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_UPGRADE_WRITE` - Perform upgrades,
 * `PRIVILEGE_WEB_UI_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Modify web UI settings

enabled.description: When enabled, allows the cluster to make S3 connections.

base_path.description: The default bucket directory prefix for all S3 buckets created without an explicitly specified path, for example, by using the CreateBucket API action. You must specify this directory as an absolute path.

multipart_upload_expiry_interval.description: The time period during which the system permits a multipart upload to remain unmodified. When this time period elapses, the system considers the multipart upload stale and cleans it up automatically. Specify the time period in the <quantity><units> format (for example, 5days). Quantity must be a positive integer less than 100 and units must be one of the following: months, weeks, days, or hours. To disable automatic multipart upload cleanup, specify never for quantity and do not specify any units.

secure.description: If you specify true, the S3 server accepts only HTTP connections. By default, the S3 server accepts only HTTP connections.

private.description: Specifies whether to create a private S3 bucket. By default, Qumulo Core creates the bucket without a policy, allowing all S3 API users to perform S3 object read and write operations and the S3 bucket's creator and users with RBAC permissions to perform S3 bucket write operations. When enabled, Qumulo Core applies a policy that restricts both S3 object and S3 bucket operations to the S3 bucket's creator and users with RBAC permissions.

parameters.description: Bucket name

delete.summary: Aborts an in-progress upload and releases all allocated storage.

enabled.description: When enabled, the cluster accepts SAML authentication. It is necessary first to create a SAML integration for the cluster with a third-party SSO service (that will act as a SAML Identity Provider) and obtain IdP SSO URL and X.509 certificate. Use https://cluster-fqdn/saml for the Service Provider endpoint when creating the SAML integration. The cluster must be joined to an Active Directory domain, and the SSO service must be connected to the same domain.

idp_sso_url.description: IdP SSO URL. The cluster will send a SAML authentication request to this URL to ask for a Single Sign-On from the Identity Provider.

idp_certificate.description: IdP X.509 certificate in PEM format. The cluster will use it to validate the SAML Response received from the Identity Provider before granting the user from the response a bearer token to access the cluster.

idp_entity_id.description: IdP entity ID. Must be a URI provided by the IdP. The cluster will use it to prepare correctly-formed SAML requests to the IdP and to verify that received SAML responses came from that IdP.

cluster_dns_name.description: DNS name of the cluster. Must be of the form `cluster.domain.com`. The cluster uses this to correctly redirect authentication flows back to itself when the user attempts to log in to the Identity Provider.

require_sso.description: If set, requires SSO for Active Directory (AD) users to be able to manage this cluster. The cluster rejects password-based authentication from AD users of the Web UI, qq CLI, and REST API. This setting does not restrict access over file protocols such as SMB.

parameters.name: identity
parameters.description: List only sessions matching a user identity in the form of: [1] A name or a SID optionally qualified with a domain prefix (e.g local:name, S-1-1-0, name, world:Everyone, ldap_user:name, or ad:name), or [2] An ID type (e.g. uid:1001, auth_id:513, SID:S-1-1-0).)

schema.description: List only sessions matching a user identity in the form of: [1] A name or a SID optionally qualified with a domain prefix (e.g local:name, S-1-1-0, name, world:Everyone, ldap_user:name, or ad:name), or [2] An ID type (e.g. uid:1001, auth_id:513, SID:S-1-1-0).)

items.description:
Rights pertaining to the permissions entry:
 * `ADD_FILE` - File creation access,
 * `ADD_SUBDIR` - Directory creation access,
 * `ALL` - All access rights,
 * `CHANGE_OWNER` - Owner write access,
 * `CHANGE_PERMISSIONS` - Rights to change permissions on file objects,
 * `DELETE` - Delete access,
 * `DELETE_CHILD` - Delete from directory access,
 * `EXECUTE` - Execute access,
 * `EXTEND` - File extension access,
 * `MODIFY` - File modification access,
 * `READ` - Read access rights,
 * `READ_ACL` - ACL read access,
 * `READ_ATTR` - Attribute read access,
 * `READ_DATA` - File read access,
 * `READ_EA` - Extended attribute read access,
 * `SYNCHRONIZE` - File synchronize access,
 * `WRITE` - Write access rights,
 * `WRITE_ACL` - ACL write access,
 * `WRITE_ATTR` - Attribute write access,
 * `WRITE_EA` - Extended attribute write access,
 * `WRITE_GROUP` - Group write access
The network access control list (ACL) for this SMB share. If not specified, the default is to allow any host.

items.description:
The user's privileges:
 * `PRIVILEGE_ACCESS_TOKENS_READ` - View any access tokens present in the system,
 * `PRIVILEGE_ACCESS_TOKENS_WRITE` - Create or delete access tokens for any user in the system,
 * `PRIVILEGE_AD_READ` - Read Qumulo Active Directory settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_AD_USE` - Use Qumulo's APIs for performing queries against Active Directory,
 * `PRIVILEGE_AD_WRITE` - Modify Qumulo Active Directory settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_ANALYTICS_READ` - Read cluster analytics,
 * `PRIVILEGE_AUDIT_READ` - Read audit settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_AUDIT_WRITE` - Modify audit settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_AUTH_CACHE_READ` - Internal-Only: Read authentication cache settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_AUTH_CACHE_WRITE` - Internal-Only: Modify authentication cache settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_CAPACITY_READ` - View the capacity clamp value.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_CAPACITY_WRITE` - Set the capacity clamp value.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_CHECKSUMMING_READ` - View the status of checksumming,
 * `PRIVILEGE_CLUSTER_READ` - View nodes, disks, protection status, and SSL certificate,
 * `PRIVILEGE_CLUSTER_WRITE` - Modify cluster settings and disk/identify LEDs,
 * `PRIVILEGE_DEBUG` - Internal-Only: Perform debug operations on the cluster,
 * `PRIVILEGE_DISK_ERROR_READ` - Internal-Only: Read disk error threshold and status.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_DISK_ERROR_WRITE` - Internal-Only: Modify disk error threshold and revive rejected disks.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_DNS_READ` - Read DNS settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_DNS_USE` - Perform DNS lookups,
 * `PRIVILEGE_DNS_WRITE` - Modify DNS settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_ENCRYPTION_READ` - View the status of at-rest-encryption,
 * `PRIVILEGE_ENCRYPTION_WRITE` - Rotate encryption keys for clusters with at-rest-encryption,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FILE_FULL_ACCESS` - Provides full access to all files regardless of permissions,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FILE_READ_ACCESS` - Provides read access to all files regardless of permissions,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_ATTRIBUTES_READ` - Read file system statistics,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_DELETE_TREE_READ` - View the status of directory tree delete operations,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_DELETE_TREE_WRITE` - Use directory tree delete API. Granting this privilege allows the deletion of any file or directory on the cluster. File and directory permissions are not taken into account. Not required for `rm -r`.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_FILE_LOCK_WRITE` - Set or extend file lock retention periods and legal holds.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_KEY_MANAGEMENT_READ` - Read and list public keys for various FS security features.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_KEY_MANAGEMENT_WRITE` - Create and manage public keys for various FS security features.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_LOCK_READ` - View NLM and SMB locks and waiters,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_LOCK_WRITE` - Release NLM and SMB locks,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_SETTINGS_READ` - View file system permissions settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FS_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Modify file system permissions mode,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FTP_READ` - View FTP status and settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_FTP_WRITE` - Modify FTP status and settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_CONFIG_READ` - Read and list identity configurations.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_CONFIG_WRITE` - Modify identity configurations.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_MAPPING_READ` - Get AD/LDAP User Defined Mappings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_MAPPING_WRITE` - Set AD/LDAP User Defined Mappings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_READ` - Use Qumulo's identity lookup and translation APIs,
 * `PRIVILEGE_IDENTITY_WRITE` - Modify identity attributes and clear authentication cache,
 * `PRIVILEGE_KERBEROS_KEYTAB_READ` - View Kerberos keytab,
 * `PRIVILEGE_KERBEROS_KEYTAB_WRITE` - Modify Kerberos keytab,
 * `PRIVILEGE_KERBEROS_SETTINGS_READ` - Read Kerberos settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_KERBEROS_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Modify Kerberos settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_KV_READ` - DEPRECATED: Read and delete KV store entries for all users,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LDAP_READ` - View LDAP settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LDAP_USE` - Use Qumulo's APIs for performing LDAP queries,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LDAP_WRITE` - Modify LDAP settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LICENSE_READ` - Get the cluster's license status.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LOCAL_GROUP_READ` - View local groups and members,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LOCAL_GROUP_WRITE` - Modify local groups and membership,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LOCAL_USER_READ` - Get information about local users,
 * `PRIVILEGE_LOCAL_USER_WRITE` - Create and modify all local users,
 * `PRIVILEGE_METRICS_CONFIG_READ` - View metrics configuration,
 * `PRIVILEGE_METRICS_CONFIG_WRITE` - Modify metrics configuration,
 * `PRIVILEGE_METRICS_READ` - Get all metrics,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NETWORK_IP_ALLOCATION_READ` - View network IP address allocations,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NETWORK_READ` - Read network status and settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NETWORK_WRITE` - Modify network configuration,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NFS_EXPORT_READ` - View configuration of NFS exports,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NFS_EXPORT_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete NFS exports,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NFS_SETTINGS_READ` - Internal-Only: View NFS server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_NFS_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Internal-Only: Modify NFS server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_OBJECT_STORAGE_URIS_READ` - View the object storage URIs.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_OBJECT_STORAGE_URIS_WRITE` - Add new object storage URIs.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_GLOBAL_READ` - View global portal settings and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_HUB_READ` - View hub portal relationship status and configuration,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_HUB_WRITE` - Authorize, modify, and delete hub portal relationships. Granting this privilege allows authorizing proposed relationships. Depending on existing file and directory permissions, this privilege can allow remote access to local data under the hub root directory.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_SPOKE_EVICT` - Remove cached files and directories from a spoke portal. Qumulo Core recaches the removed files or directories upon access.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_SPOKE_READ` - View spoke portal relationship status and configuration,
 * `PRIVILEGE_PORTAL_SPOKE_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete spoke portal relationships. Granting this privilege allows creating spoke portal root directories. Depending on existing file permissions, this privilege can allow local access to remote files and directories.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_POWER_CYCLE` - Shutdown and reboot nodes,
 * `PRIVILEGE_QUOTA_READ` - View all file system quotas,
 * `PRIVILEGE_QUOTA_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete file system quotas,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REBOOT_READ` - View Reboot Status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REBOOT_USE` - Perform Reboots,
 * `PRIVILEGE_RECONCILER_READ` - View reconciler status and metrics,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_OBJECT_READ` - View object store relationship settings and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_OBJECT_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete object store relationships. Granting this privilege allows overwriting existing data, replicating, and potentially accessing any data on the cluster regardless of file and directory permissions.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_REVERSE_RELATIONSHIP` - Reverse a source and target relationship,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_SOURCE_READ` - View source relationship settings and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_SOURCE_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete source relationships. Granting this privilege allows replicating and potentially accessing any data on the cluster regardless of file and directory permissions.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_TARGET_READ` - View target relationship settings and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_REPLICATION_TARGET_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete target relationships. Granting this privilege allows overwriting any data on the cluster regardless of file and directory permissions.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_ROLE_READ` - View roles and assignments,
 * `PRIVILEGE_ROLE_WRITE` - Create and modify roles and assignments,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_BUCKETS_READ` - View all S3 buckets and bucket policies present in the system,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_BUCKETS_WRITE` - Create or delete any S3 bucket in the system, and create, delete, or modify policies for any S3 bucket in the system. Subject to having sufficient FS permissions.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_CREDENTIALS_READ` - View any S3 access key present in the system,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_CREDENTIALS_WRITE` - Create or delete S3 access keys for any user in the system,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_SETTINGS_READ` - View S3 server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Modify S3 server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_UPLOADS_READ` - View all S3 uploads present in the system. This will override a bucket policy that denies the user this permission.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_S3_UPLOADS_WRITE` - Abort S3 uploads in the system. This will override a bucket policy that denies the user this permission.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SAML_SETTINGS_READ` - View SAML integration settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SAML_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Modify SAML integration settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SERVICE_PUBLIC_KEYS_READ` - Internal-Only: Read public keys,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SERVICE_PUBLIC_KEYS_WRITE` - Internal-Only: Write public keys,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_FILE_HANDLE_READ` - List open SMB file handles,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_FILE_HANDLE_WRITE` - Force close an open SMB file handle,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_SESSION_READ` - List logged on SMB sessions,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_SESSION_WRITE` - Force close a logged on SMB session,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_SHARE_READ` - View configuration of SMB shares and SMB server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SMB_SHARE_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete SMB shares and SMB server settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_CALCULATE_USED_CAPACITY_READ` - Recalculate capacity usage of snapshots,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_DIFFERENCE_READ` - View the changes between snapshots,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_LOCK` - Lock or unlock snapshots. Configure snapshot policies to lock or unlock snapshots.,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_POLICY_READ` - View snapshot policies and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_POLICY_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete snapshot policies,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_READ` - List snapshots and view their status and cached capacity. Does not affect the visibility of the virtual `.snapshot` directories,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SNAPSHOT_WRITE` - Create, modify, and delete snapshots,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SUPPORT_READ` - View support configuration and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_SUPPORT_WRITE` - Modify cloud-based monitoring and remote management,
 * `PRIVILEGE_TENANT_READ` - View any tenant information,
 * `PRIVILEGE_TENANT_WRITE` - Create, edit or delete tenants,
 * `PRIVILEGE_TEST_ONLY` - Test only actions,
 * `PRIVILEGE_TIME_READ` - View time and time settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_TIME_WRITE` - Modify time settings,
 * `PRIVILEGE_UNCONFIGURED_NODE_READ` - List unconfigured Qumulo nodes,
 * `PRIVILEGE_UPGRADE_READ` - View upgrade configuration and status,
 * `PRIVILEGE_UPGRADE_WRITE` - Perform upgrades,
 * `PRIVILEGE_WEB_UI_SETTINGS_WRITE` - Modify web UI settings

access_token_id.description: The user's access token ID. Only present when access token authentication is used.

get.summary: Retrieve information about the currently logged in user.
Retrieve a list of all the roles assigned to the current user, including those assigned to a group to which the current user belongs.

login_id.description: The unique identifier for the pending login. Use the login_id with the check-saml-login API.

login_url.description: The login URL to present to the user. To complete the authentication process, the user must open the login URL in a browser.

post.summary: This API resource supports the qq sso_login command. Begin an interactive SAML single sign-on (SSO) authentication process for the cluster. Return the login_id and login_url strings required for the user to complete the authentication process. If SSO is not enabled on the cluster, return saml_not_configured_error. To complete in-browser authentication, the caller must pass the login_url parameter to the user. The caller must use the login_id parameter to poll the retrieve-saml-login API for SAML SSO credentials until the user completes the authentication process in the browser, or until the 5-minute limit elapses.

This API resource supports the qq sso_login command.Check the status of the in-progress SAML single sign-on (SSO) authentication process that start-saml-login begins. When a user completes the authentication process, return the bearer_token with which a user can perform subsequent API requests. When the caller retrieves the bearer_token, future calls with the same saml_login_id return the 404 Not Found error. If authentication for login_id is pending, instruct the caller to check again later by returning an empty bearer_token. If the login_id has expired within the 5-minute limit, return the 401 Unauthorized error. If the caller has already retrieved the login-id, return the 404 Not Found error.If the provided verification code mismatches with the expected code, return the 400 Bad Request error.

login_id.description: A unique, Qumulo-generated login_id associated with a SAML SSO authentication session.

verification_code.description: A one-time security code that helps ensure that the SAML SSO authentication session is user-initiated.

post.summary: Start a reboot cycle with the Reboot Manager system.

is_rolling.description: If true, kick off a rolling reboot, otherwise do it concurrently. Defaults to false

num_nodes_to_reboot.description: If the number of nodes to reboot is configured and rolling reboot is enabled, your cluster reboots the specified number of nodes at a time. The number of nodes must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to the number of node failures that your cluster permits. By default, the value is the number of permitted node failures minus 1 (1 node minimum).

post.summary: Pause an in progress reboot cycle.
Resume a paused reboot cycle.

 * `REBOOT_PAUSED_DUE_TO_ERROR` - REBOOT_PAUSED_DUE_TO_ERROR

directory_name.description: Snapshot directory name, as would be seen in the .snapshot directory over SMB or NFS.

created_by_policy.description: This snapshot was created by a policy. The name of that policy will be stored in the name field in place of a user-defined name.

expiration.description: Time at which snapshot will be expired. Empty string if no expiration time set. Encoded as RFC 3339, which is a normalized subset of ISO 8601. See http://tools.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt, section 5.6 for ABNF.

get.summary: Returns information about all snapshots.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter the list of snapshots to exclude any combination of snapshots in process of being deleted, snapshots not in process of being deleted, locked snapshots, and unlocked snapshots. By default, includes all snapshots.

schema.description: Filter the list of snapshots to exclude any combination of snapshots in process of being deleted, snapshots not in process of being deleted, locked snapshots, and unlocked snapshots. By default, includes all snapshots.

items.description: List of snapshot statuses

id.description: The unique snapshot identifier.

name.description: The snapshot name as it appears in the .snapshot directory over SMB or NFS.

timestamp.description: The snapshot creation timestamp, encoded as RFC 3339, a normalized subset of ISO 8601.

source_file_id.description: The source file ID of the directory for the snapshot.

policy_id.description: The policy ID from which this snapshot was created, or null if this snapshot was created manually.

policy_name.description: The policy name from which this snapshot was created, or null if this snapshot was created manually or its policy was deleted.

expiration.description: The snapshot expiration time, encoded as RFC 3339, a normalized subset of ISO 8601. If expiration time is null, the snapshot never expires.

items.description: This snapshot's owners. While there are entries on this list, the snapshot can't be deleted or modified.

id.description: id

in_delete.description: Specifies whether the snapshot is in the process of being deleted.

lock_key.description: The key that the snapshot is locked with. If set to null, the system does not create locked snapshots under this policy.

get.summary: Returns the information for every snapshot. If a snapshot was created from a snapshot policy, returns information about the policy.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filter the list of snapshots to exclude snapshots in process of being deleted, or include only snapshots in process of being deleted. By default, includes all snapshots.:
 * `all` - all,
 * `exclude_in_delete` - exclude_in_delete,
 * `only_in_delete` - only_in_delete

items.description: List of snapshot policy information

id.description: The unique identifier for the snapshot policy.

snapshot_name_template.description: The naming template for the snapshots that this policy creates.

source_file_id.description: The source file ID of the directory to snapshot under this policy.

schedule.description: The schedule according to which to take snapshots under this policy.

creation_schedule.description: Structure defining when to take snapshots

frequency.description:
Coarse frequency (MONTHLY, DAILY_OR_WEEKLY, or HOURLY_OR_LESS) at which to take snapshot:
 * `SCHEDULE_DAILY_OR_WEEKLY` - SCHEDULE_DAILY_OR_WEEKLY,
 * `SCHEDULE_HOURLY_OR_LESS` - SCHEDULE_HOURLY_OR_LESS,
 * `SCHEDULE_MONTHLY` - SCHEDULE_MONTHLY

hour.description: For MONTHLY or DAILY_OR_WEEKLY frequency: Hour of day [0, 23] at which to take snapshot

minute.description: For MONTHLY or DAILY_OR_WEEKLY frequency: minute of hour [0, 59] at which to take snapshot

on_days.description: For DAILY_OR_WEEKLY or HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: list of days of the week on which to take snapshots. Choose from SUN, MON, TUE, WED, THU, FRI, and/or SAT. EVERY_DAY can be used to specify all days. For MONTHLY frequency: LAST_DAY_OF_MONTH indicates that the snapshot should be taken only on the last day of the month.

items.description:
For DAILY_OR_WEEKLY or HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: list of days of the week on which to take snapshots. Choose from SUN, MON, TUE, WED, THU, FRI, and/or SAT. EVERY_DAY can be used to specify all days. For MONTHLY frequency: LAST_DAY_OF_MONTH indicates that the snapshot should be taken only on the last day of the month.:
 * `EVERY_DAY` - EVERY_DAY,
 * `FRI` - FRI,
 * `MON` - MON,
 * `SAT` - SAT,
 * `SUN` - SUN,
 * `THU` - THU,
 * `TUE` - TUE,
 * `WED` - WED

day_of_month.description: For MONTHLY frequency: day of month on which to take snapshot. [1, 27] for specific day, 128 for last day of month.

window_start_hour.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: hour of day [0, 23] for start of window during which to take snapshots

window_start_minute.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: minute of hour [0, 59] for start of window during which to take snapshots

window_end_hour.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: hour of day [0, 23] for end of window during which to take snapshots)

window_end_minute.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: minute of hour [0, 59] for end of window during which to take snapshots

fire_every_interval.description:
For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: units for interval (MINUTES or HOURS) at which to take snapshot during specified window:
 * `FIRE_IN_HOURS` - FIRE_IN_HOURS,
 * `FIRE_IN_MINUTES` - FIRE_IN_MINUTES

fire_every.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: value for interval [1, 99] at which to take snapshot during specified window

expiration_time_to_live.description: Duration after which to expire snapshots created by this policy, in format <quantity><units>, where <quantity> is a positive integer less than 100 and <units> is one of [months, weeks, days, hours, minutes], e.g. 5days or 1hours. Empty string or never indicates snapshots should never expire.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Policy identifier

id.description: The unique identifier for the snapshot policy.

snapshot_name_template.description: The naming template for the snapshots that this policy created.

source_file_id.description: The source file ID of the directory to snapshot under this policy.

schedule.description: The schedule according to which to take snapshots for the policy.

id.description: Identifier for the snapshot policy's schedule. Only unique within the scope of a snapshot policy.

creation_schedule.description: Structure defining when to take snapshots

timezone.description: The time zone in which the schedule should be interpreted (e.g. America/Los_Angeles or UTC).

frequency.description:
Coarse frequency (MONTHLY, DAILY_OR_WEEKLY, or HOURLY_OR_LESS) at which to take snapshot:
 * `SCHEDULE_DAILY_OR_WEEKLY` - SCHEDULE_DAILY_OR_WEEKLY,
 * `SCHEDULE_HOURLY_OR_LESS` - SCHEDULE_HOURLY_OR_LESS,
 * `SCHEDULE_MONTHLY` - SCHEDULE_MONTHLY

hour.description: For MONTHLY or DAILY_OR_WEEKLY frequency: Hour of day [0, 23] at which to take snapshot

minute.description: For MONTHLY or DAILY_OR_WEEKLY frequency: minute of hour [0, 59] at which to take snapshot

on_days.description: For DAILY_OR_WEEKLY or HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: list of days of the week on which to take snapshots. Choose from SUN, MON, TUE, WED, THU, FRI, and/or SAT. EVERY_DAY can be used to specify all days. For MONTHLY frequency: LAST_DAY_OF_MONTH indicates that the snapshot should be taken only on the last day of the month.

items.description:
For DAILY_OR_WEEKLY or HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: list of days of the week on which to take snapshots. Choose from SUN, MON, TUE, WED, THU, FRI, and/or SAT. EVERY_DAY can be used to specify all days. For MONTHLY frequency: LAST_DAY_OF_MONTH indicates that the snapshot should be taken only on the last day of the month.:
 * `EVERY_DAY` - EVERY_DAY,
 * `FRI` - FRI,
 * `MON` - MON,
 * `SAT` - SAT,
 * `SUN` - SUN,
 * `THU` - THU,
 * `TUE` - TUE,
 * `WED` - WED

day_of_month.description: For MONTHLY frequency: day of month on which to take snapshot. [1, 27] for specific day, 128 for last day of month.

window_start_hour.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: hour of day [0, 23] for start of window during which to take snapshots

window_start_minute.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: minute of hour [0, 59] for start of window during which to take snapshots

window_end_hour.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: hour of day [0, 23] for end of window during which to take snapshots)

window_end_minute.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: minute of hour [0, 59] for end of window during which to take snapshots

fire_every_interval.description:
For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: units for interval (MINUTES or HOURS) at which to take snapshot during specified window:
 * `FIRE_IN_HOURS` - FIRE_IN_HOURS,
 * `FIRE_IN_MINUTES` - FIRE_IN_MINUTES

fire_every.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: value for interval [1, 99] at which to take snapshot during specified window

expiration_time_to_live.description: Duration after which to expire snapshots created by this policy, in format <quantity><units>, where <quantity> is a positive integer less than 100 and <units> is one of [months, weeks, days, hours, minutes], e.g. 5days or 1hours. Empty string or never indicates snapshots should never expire.

enabled.description: Specifies whether taking snapshots is enabled for this policy.

items.description: The snapshot policy's owners. While there are entries on this list, the policy can't be deleted or modified.

id.description: id

enabled.description: Whether snapshot taking is enabled for this policy (defaults to true)

items.description: Status of the source directory for the policy. The array contains exactly one status.

source_file_id.description: File ID of the snapshot source directory

source_file_path.description: File path of the snapshot source directory, if available

deleted.description: True if the source directory is deleted

items.description: Owners of this snapshot policy. The policy can only be modified but not deleted while the list is non-empty.

 * `SCHEDULE_HOURLY_OR_LESS` - SCHEDULE_HOURLY_OR_LESS,

hour.description: For MONTHLY or DAILY_OR_WEEKLY frequency: Hour of day [0, 23] at which to take snapshot

minute.description: For MONTHLY or DAILY_OR_WEEKLY frequency: minute of hour [0, 59] at which to take snapshot

on_days.description: For DAILY_OR_WEEKLY or HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: list of days of the week on which to take snapshots. Choose from SUN, MON, TUE, WED, THU, FRI, and/or SAT. EVERY_DAY can be used to specify all days. For MONTHLY frequency: LAST_DAY_OF_MONTH indicates that the snapshot should be taken only on the last day of the month.

items.description:

For MONTHLY frequency: LAST_DAY_OF_MONTH indicates that the snapshot should be taken only on the last day of the month.:
 * `EVERY_DAY` - EVERY_DAY,
 * `FRI` - FRI,
 * `MON` - MON,
 * `SAT` - SAT,
 * `SUN` - SUN,
 * `THU` - THU,
 * `TUE` - TUE,
 * `WED` - WED

day_of_month.description: For MONTHLY frequency: day of month on which to take snapshot. [1, 27] for specific day, 128 for last day of month.

window_start_hour.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: hour of day [0, 23] for start of window during which to take snapshots

window_start_minute.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: minute of hour [0, 59] for start of window during which to take snapshots

window_end_minute.description: For HOURLY_OR_LESS frequency: minute of hour [0, 59] for end of window during which to take snapshots

 * `MON` - MON,
 * `SAT` - SAT,
 * `SUN` - SUN,
 * `THU` - THU,
 * `TUE` - TUE,
 * `WED` - WED

in_delete.description: Specifies whether the snapshot is in the process of being deleted.

type.description:
The type of content in the changed region of the file in the newer snapshot. The region may contain either data a hole.:

offset.description: The starting offset of the changed region in bytes.

size.description: The size of the changed region in bytes.

get.summary: Returns a list of changed byte ranges between two snapshots of a regular file. The list includes new, modified, and deallocated regions of the file's contents.

Retrieve the version of the appliance.
Check if upgrade is currently blocked.

post.summary: Verify that the given image can be used to upgrade the cluster and retrieve details about the upgrade that will occur.
Prepare for upgrade.

auto_commit.description: If true, the system will automatically commit when prepare is complete

do_rolling_reboot.description: If true, do a rolling reboot after the upgrade is committed if doing a full platform upgrade

num_nodes_to_reboot.description: If the number of nodes to reboot is configured and rolling reboot is enabled, your cluster reboots the specified number of nodes at a time. The number of nodes must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to the number of node failures that your cluster permits. By default, the value is the number of permitted node failures minus 1 (1 node minimum).

post.summary: Commit a prepared upgrade.

state.description:
state:
 * `UPGRADE_STATE_COMMITTED` - UPGRADE_STATE_COMMITTED,
 * `UPGRADE_STATE_COMMITTING` - UPGRADE_STATE_COMMITTING,
 * `UPGRADE_STATE_IDLE` - UPGRADE_STATE_IDLE,
 * `UPGRADE_STATE_PREPARED` - UPGRADE_STATE_PREPARED,
 * `UPGRADE_STATE_PREPARING` - UPGRADE_STATE_PREPARING,
 * `UPGRADE_STATE_REBOOTING` - UPGRADE_STATE_REBOOTING
